Redistricting requirements


In Iowa, districts must:


be contiguous


have equal populations


be constructed only from counties


be geographically compact, as defined by two compactness measures:

length-width compactness, which measures the total absolute difference between the length and width of a district, across all districts


perimeter compactness, which measures the total perimeter of all districts

Redistricting requirements


In Oregon, districts must, under Or. Rev. Stat. § 188.010:


be contiguous


be of equal population


utilize existing geographic or political boundaries


not divide communities of common interest


be connected by transportation links


Additionally, districts may not favor any political party or incumbent, and may not dilute the voting strength of any language or ethnic minority group.
